column13: > This polybag from LEGO Guardians of the Galaxy Volume Two is a very fun little build of the titular ship from both films. There are, unfortunately, no printed elements here, but the model is still quite fun as the pros and cons will discuss.

column16: >Model uses good amount of pieces to capture the look of the Milano in a micro-build commonly found in Polybags.
>Common LEGO Elements included, making for good parts pack for MOCs.
>Fun to play with, includes adjustable wing elements and an unprinted grey NEXO power.
>Lack of printed detailing to capture the dings and dents on the Milano or the proper look of the ship from the movies is unfortunate.
>Adjustable wings slightly difficult to arrange without popping Technic Pin out of Socket.

column8: >This is a great Polybag and very welcome, we&rsquo
column9: ve had Quinjets and other vehicles in this scale and range before, but this is the first attempt at a Milano and a very welcome addition to the collection of Milano space ships. Definitely strongly recommended if you can still find it at retail don&rsquo

column1: The set comes in the normal polybag
column2: with the normal size instruction manual that you get in polybags.&nbsp
t any cool or unique parts, although I do like the blue and orange pieces that you get in the set.&nbsp

column1: The build was quick and easy. It took me under 2 minutes to build it.
When I was finished with it was a really nice mini version of the Milano. The six wings on it are really nice as well.
Overall this is a great set. The resemblance to the larger scale is really good. Being able to move the wings around is also nice. Overall I'
column2: m giving it a 5 star rating.&nbsp
